body:
I already Konw it comes from
 'module = JoinTable(dimension, nInputDims)'
But when I convert the model  to pytorch , error appears:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 173, in <module>
    G_net_f       =generator.forward(input)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/legacy/nn/Module.py", line 33, in forward
    return self.updateOutput(input)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/legacy/nn/Sequential.py", line 36, in updateOutput
    currentOutput = module.updateOutput(currentOutput)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/legacy/nn/JoinTable.py", line 37, in updateOutput
    self.output.narrow(dim, offset, currentOutput.size(dim)).copy_(currentOutput)
RuntimeError: inconsistent tensor size at /home/lxl/pytorch-master/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensorCopy.c:51
